meanings.definition: To do less than is necessary or required.
meanings.sent1: I always underdo my chores, so my mom gets upset.
meanings.sent2: Don't underdo your studying for the test; make sure you understand everything.
meanings.sent3: I tend to underdo my breakfast, ending up hungry before lunch.
meanings.sent4: She underdid her speech, leaving out important details.
meanings.sent5: It's better to overdo than to underdo when it comes to safety precautions.

meanings.definition: To fail to do as well as expected.
meanings.sent1: If you underdo your training, you might not perform well in the race.
meanings.sent2: He tends to underdo his assignments, resulting in lower grades.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally underdid my baking, and the cookies turned out too soft.
meanings.sent4: She underdid her presentation, causing confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent5: Never underdo your efforts when aiming for success.

meanings.sent1: When you underdo your job, it reflects poorly on your work ethic.
meanings.sent2: The team underdid their practice, leading to a disappointing performance.
meanings.sent3: I always seem to underdo my jokes, and no one finds them funny.
meanings.sent4: She underdid her role in the play, making the scene less impactful.
meanings.sent5: It's important not to underdo your responsibilities at work.
